result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M Lark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence credit of 10 days is granted. TIME SERVED.

-Court orders 31 days credit and waives standard court costs. 
-DNA Surcharge to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing on 10-15-2022 and each month thereafter. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dawn M Lark

defendant.name: Lark, Dawn M
defendant.address: 7008 W National Ave # 2, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:52 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Dawn M Lark in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Dawn M Lark. 

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 3.
Counts 1, 2, & 4 are dismissed and read into Count 3.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  10 days (Credit - 10 days). TIME SERVED;

COSTS: WAIVED 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

The Court orders 31 days credit and waives court costs.

Payment of Costs/Surcharges/Fine: Defendant to pay $50.00 /month commencing October 15, 2022 and each month thereafter or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:38 AM Defendant Dawn M Lark in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Herbers is appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Atty Miller advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Notice of Completion of Representation. From Atty Cassandra Miller

records.addlTxt: Attorney Andy Herbers has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Initial appearance on June 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Dawn M Lark not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the defendant contacted the Clerk's Office at 9:38 a.m. stating she needed to take her father to the hospital and would try to make it to Court.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
